column4: Can someone please give me a hand getting hibernate to work? Problem is probably related to the swap file.
do you have a swap *partition* that is bigger than your ram ?
yes, please take a look at here: http://karel.awardspace.com/FPD/?path=/Rest, although it says swap TOO small, I think it is related to not seeing the swap or so
i can't fully see what's going on, but my impression is that the kernel looks for the wrong partition to et iss hibernation file
I believe that's exactly what's going on
there's some boot parameters to define what partition holds the hibernation file... it's just that i can't remember, because it works too well here
!suspend | karel
The UUID reference in /etc/fstab was wrong, fixed it and it seems to be fixed still, but it changed again some time ago
maybe this helps http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=471855&highlight=suspend
apt-get can't resolve the host to download it, but apart from that, how do I check what my swap partition SHOULD be?
!uuid | karel
the uuid there is wrong
or it doesn't exists..
I thought /dev/sda5 was my swap partition
that's what the line of blkid says btw, /dev/sda5
so your swap doesn't have a UUID ?
it does, but it's a different one
!raid
!info dosbox
any idea's?
not really... except being pissed by the supid idea of ubuntu-devs to introduce UUID mounts for swap and hibernate
